main event: Multiple witnesses reported sighting a bright object in the sky near the sun on June 1, 1960, in Ponce, Puerto Rico.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 45 minutes and was seen reflecting sunlight., The object appeared to be very close to the sun, laying parallel to it., An initial misidentification arose, believing it to be a UFO, whereas it was later concluded to be the planet Venus., Witnesses described a sudden disappearance of the object after a brief duration., The sighting occurred in broad daylight, making it a novel experience for the observers.
sighted object: an unidentified bright object, later identified as Venus
